Description: Rim, wall, foot and floor sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery plate; rounded, incurving rim ridged on exterior; slightly convex ring foot, concave on interior, with bevelled, grooved resting surface; groove at junction with wall; glazed black on interior, exterior and underside; reserved: top of rim, resting surface; rouletting on interior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Piekarski 2001 / p.48 no. D17 pl. 22.1 Compare Rotroff, Agora XXIX no. 654, fig. 46, pl. 61.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.48, no. D17, pl. 22.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.040)
